items.title: ICE officer shoots man in leg in Minneapolis after shovel attack, officials say
items.standfirst: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer​ shot a man Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after allegedly being attacked by men with shovels during an arrest operation, three U.S. officials told CBS News.
items.content: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer​ shot a man Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after allegedly being attacked by men with shovels during an arrest operation, three U.S. officials told CBS News.

items.title: European troops arrive in Greenland for training after fraught US talks
items.standfirst: European troops are arriving in Greenland for training in the territory following fraught talks in Washington between the territory, Denmark and the US. US President Donald Trump has repeatedly said he wants the mineral-rich, strategic territory to be taken over by the United States. #greenland #trump #nato

items.content: Some European countries are sending soldiers to the Arctic island after Donald Trump intensified threats to take control

items.title: Greenlanders hope for peace after talks in Washington
items.standfirst: In Nuuk, all eyes were on the meeting between US, Danish and Greenlander officials in the White House on January 14 to address US President Donald Trump's desire to take over the Danish territory. Greenland's deputy prime minister announced afterwards NATO troops would be arriving for training "in the coming days". #greenland #trump #nato
items.content: In Nuuk, all eyes were on the meeting between US, Danish and Greenlander officials in the White House on January 14 to address US President Donald Trump's desire to take over the Danish territory. Greenland's deputy prime minister announced afterwards NATO troops would be arriving for training "in the coming days". #greenland #trump #nato

items.title: Greenland, Denmark and the US "agree to disagree" after talks at the White House
items.standfirst: Greenland and Denmark on Wednesday said they "agree to disagree" with US diplomats, following what they described as a "frank and constructive" discussion at the White House over President Donald Trump's desire to acquire the autonomous territory. Story by August Hakansson.
items.content: Greenland and Denmark on Wednesday said they "agree to disagree" with US diplomats, following what they described as a "frank and constructive" discussion at the White House over President Donald Trump's desire to acquire the autonomous territory. Story by August Hakansson.

items.title: France to send extra 'land, air, and sea' forces to Greenland in coming days, says Macron
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron Thursday said France would soon send more "land, air, and sea" forces to join a European military exercise in Greenland, after Washington threatened to seize the autonomous Danish territory. Analysis by France 24 reporter Olivia Bizot.
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron Thursday said France would soon send more "land, air, and sea" forces to join a European military exercise in Greenland, after Washington threatened to seize the autonomous Danish territory. Analysis by France 24 reporter Olivia Bizot.

items.content: European troops were arriving in Greenland on Thursday in a show of support, as leaders scrambled to respond to President Donald Trump’s threats.

items.title: European troops arrive in Greenland as talks with US hit wall over future
items.standfirst: France sends 15 soldiers, Germany 13. Norway, Sweden also participating to bolster security on Arctic island.
items.content: France sends 15 soldiers, Germany 13. Norway, Sweden also participating to bolster security on Arctic island.

items.title: France to send more forces to Greenland, says Emmanuel Macron
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron Thursday said France would soon send more "land, air, and sea" forces to join a European military exercise in Greenland, after Washington threatened to seize the autonomous Danish territory. Analysis by Marc Perelman, FRANCE 24 French politics editor.
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron Thursday said France would soon send more "land, air, and sea" forces to join a European military exercise in Greenland, after Washington threatened to seize the autonomous Danish territory. Analysis by Marc Perelman, FRANCE 24 French politics editor.

items.title: REPLAY - France's Emmanuel Macron maps out his vision for the military in 2026
items.standfirst: France has already deployed "an initial team of soldiers" to Greenland as part of a European military mission, and will send new "land, air and sea resources" to the autonomous Danish territory coveted by the United States "in the coming days", Emmanuel Macron announced on Thursday.
items.content: France has already deployed "an initial team of soldiers" to Greenland as part of a European military mission, and will send new "land, air and sea resources" to the autonomous Danish territory coveted by the United States "in the coming days", Emmanuel Macron announced on Thursday.

items.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
items.standfirst: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.
items.content: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)

items.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreements' over Greenland after White House talks
items.standfirst: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".
items.content: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".

items.title: Trump still intent on 'conquering Greenland,' Denmark says after White House talks

items.content: Denmark said it did not manage to dissuade President Donald Trump from seeking to conquer Greenland during high-level talks at the White House on Wednesday.

items.title: Trump to meet Venezuela opposition leader Machado at White House
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is set to meet Thursday at the White House with Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, whose political party is widely considered to have won 2024 elections rejected by then-President Nicolás Maduro before the United States captured him in an audacious military raid this month. Details and analysis by Kethevane Gorjestani, FRANCE 24 international affairs editor.

items.title: Trump to discuss Venezuela’s future with Machado after Maduro’s capture
items.standfirst: Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel prize winner had been sidelined by White House after US seized MaduroDonald Trump will host María Corina Machado, the Venezuelan opposition leader and 2025 Nobel peace prize winner, at the White House on Thursday for high-stakes talks on the oil-rich nation’s future following the US capture of Nicolás Maduro.Many in Venezuela and abroad had expected Machado to take charge after an elite US military team seized Maduro in a pre-dawn raid on 3 January and transported him to a New York City jail. items.title: U.S. seizes sixth oil tanker linked to Venezuela

items.content: Video released by the US military shows troops boarding an oil tanker, said to have links to Venezuela.

items.title: US military seizes sixth oil tanker it says has links to Venezuela
items.standfirst: The US military said on Thursday it had seized another oil tanker that it said was contravening US sanctions on Venezuelan oil exports. The Veronica tanker, which was captured in the Caribbean Sea, is the sixth such vessel to be seized by the US since the ouster of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro on January 3.
items.content: The US military said on Thursday it had seized another oil tanker that it said was contravening US sanctions on Venezuelan oil exports. The Veronica tanker, which was captured in the Caribbean Sea, is the sixth such vessel to be seized by the US since the ouster of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro on January 3.

items.title: US military seizes Venezuela oil tanker under Trump sanctions
items.standfirst: US Coast Guard and others boarded foreign-flagged crude carrier Veronica in a pre-dawn operationThe US military has seized another oil tanker at sea in support of Donald Trump’s sanctions against Venezuela, military officials announced on Thursday.Veronica, a crude oil tanker that marine records suggest is sailing under a Guyanese flag, was boarded in a pre-dawn action by US marines and sailors, the US Southern Command said in a post on social media. Continue reading...
items.content: US Coast Guard and others boarded foreign-flagged crude carrier Veronica in a pre-dawn operationThe US military has seized another oil tanker at sea in support of Donald Trump’s sanctions against Venezuela, military officials announced on Thursday.Veronica, a crude oil tanker that marine records suggest is sailing under a Guyanese flag, was boarded in a pre-dawn action by US marines and sailors, the US Southern Command said in a post on social media. items.standfirst: From Venezuela and Iran, Trump has attacked countries in the past when diplomacy appeared to be working.
items.content: From Venezuela and Iran, Trump has attacked countries in the past when diplomacy appeared to be working.

items.title: Trump says Iran has told him ‘killing has stopped’ as he pulls back from strike threats
items.standfirst: US president says he has been assured by Tehran ‘there’s no plan for executions’ of protesters Iran protests – live updatesIran crisis explained: what we know so farAnalysis: why western diplomats are wary of predicting regime’s end daysDonald Trump has at least temporarily pulled back from threats to strike Iran, saying he has been assured the killing of protesters has been halted and no executions are being planned.Speaking to reporters in the White House on Wednesday night, the US president said: “We’ve been told that the killing in Iran is stopping – it’s stopped – it’s stopping. And there’s no plan for executions, or an execution, or execution – so I’ve been told that on good authority.” He offered no details and said the US had yet to verify the claims. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says he has been assured by Tehran ‘there’s no plan for executions’ of protesters Iran protests – live updatesIran crisis explained: what we know so farAnalysis: why western diplomats are wary of predicting regime’s end daysDonald Trump has at least temporarily pulled back from threats to strike Iran, saying he has been assured the killing of protesters has been halted and no executions are being planned.Speaking to reporters in the White House on Wednesday night, the US president said: “We’ve been told that the killing in Iran is stopping – it’s stopped – it’s stopping. And there’s no plan for executions, or an execution, or execution – so I’ve been told that on good authority.” He offered no details and said the US had yet to verify the claims. Continue reading...

items.title: NASA sends fours astronauts back to Earth in first-ever medical evacuation
items.standfirst: For the first time in history, four astronauts aboard the International Space Station had to leave orbit early, because of an undisclosed medical condition of one of the crew members. Their capsule has landed safely in the Pacific. Story by Solange Mougin.
items.content: For the first time in history, four astronauts aboard the International Space Station had to leave orbit early, because of an undisclosed medical condition of one of the crew members. Their capsule has landed safely in the Pacific. Story by Solange Mougin.

items.title: International Space Station astronauts back on Earth after first ever emergency return

items.content: An astronaut who had a "serious medical condition" onboard the International Space Station is safely back on Earth, after the first-ever emergency return space flight.

items.title: Apple and tech hardware stocks face ‘crisis’ as memory prices soar
items.standfirst: (Bloomberg/Ryan Vlastelica) — Soaring prices for memory and storage components have turned companies like Sandisk Corp., Micron Technology Inc. and Western Digital Corp. into the hottest stocks in the market over the past year. items.title: Spotify Is Raising U.S. Subscription Prices in the Next Month
items.standfirst: As expected, Spotify is increasing the prices of its premium, ad-free streaming plans in the U.S. over the next month, the company announced early Thursday. It’s the third price hike in four years for Spotify in the U.S. The increase in the U.S. has been expected, after Spotify raised prices in…

items.title: Xreal Files Patent Suit Against Rival Smart Glasses Maker Viture
Xreal Files Patent Suit Against Rival Smart Glasses Maker Viture (1)
items.standfirst: Xreal Inc., a Chinese pioneer in smart glasses, is suing Viture Inc. for patent infringement in the US, arguing its rival has unfairly capitalized on Xreal’s extensive research and investment in the segment.
items.content: Xreal Inc., a Chinese pioneer in smart glasses, is suing Viture Inc. for patent infringement in the US, arguing its rival has unfairly capitalized on Xreal’s extensive research and investment in the segment.

clusters.title: Letter: a top House Republican warns severe DRAM and HBM3E supply shortages may constrain H200 export licenses; Nvidia says it “can serve all approved” orders
clusters.neutral_headline: Memory Shortage to Hit Nvidia China Approvals, US Lawmaker Says

items.title: Letter: a top House Republican warns severe DRAM and HBM3E supply shortages may constrain H200 export licenses; Nvidia says it “can serve all approved” orders
Memory Shortage to Hit Nvidia China Approvals, US Lawmaker Says
items.standfirst: Tight memory chip supplies will constrain the number of US export licenses for Nvidia Corp. to sell its H200 artificial intelligence processors to Chinese customers, according to the top Republican on the House China committee, citing terms of a Commerce Department rule issued this week.
items.content: Tight memory chip supplies will constrain the number of US export licenses for Nvidia Corp. to sell its H200 artificial intelligence processors to Chinese customers, according to the top Republican on the House China committee, citing terms of a Commerce Department rule issued this week.

items.title: Verizon Outage Knocks Out US Mobile Service, Including Some 911 Calls

items.title: Trump's Gaza peace plan enters second phase
items.standfirst: The United States will push forward with the next phase of its plan for peace in Gaza, moving toward "demilitarization, technocratic governance, and reconstruction," President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff said Wednesday
